radiographic_examinations.findings: No perfusion abnormalities during stress or at rest; left ventricular ejection fraction was 68%.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Showed a large irreversible defect in the inferolateral wall, with partial reversibility in the inferior wall.

radiographic_examinations.findings: No coronary calcium was observed; total coronary calcium score 0.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Contrast-enhanced multislice computed tomographic coronary angiography
radiographic_examinations.findings: Presence of diffuse non-obstructive (up to 50%) luminal narrowing, noncalcified plaques.
Hypokinesia in the inferolateral regions with moderate (grade 2) mitral regurgitation.
Subendocardial infarction in the inferolateral wall.
New development of negative T waves in leads II, III, aVF, V5, and V6.
